hypothesis_content.title: ETF Flow Reversal Amplification
hypothesis_content.statement: When spot Bitcoin ETFs experience 3+ consecutive days of net outflows totaling >$500M, a single day of net inflows >$200M will trigger a disproportionately large positive price move (>2x the inflow/float impact) as short-term bears cover and momentum algorithms detect trend reversal.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended ETF outflows create a narrative of 'selling pressure' that attracts short sellers. A sudden reversal in flows acts as a catalyst that forces bearish repositioning. The amplification comes from both short covering and momentum traders piling into a perceived narrative shift.
entry_conditions: Spot BTC ETFs show 3+ consecutive days of net outflows per Farside data
Today's 4PM ET ETF flow data shows net inflows > $200M
BTC price is above the daily low from the outflow period (no new lows)
Enter on next hourly candle open after flow confirmation

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move from entry or next resistance level (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Below the low of the outflow period

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Inflow days following outflows result in average returns statistically indistinguishable from random days, or price fails to hold gains by the next day's close.
